metadata.Name: Arukikata Travelogue Dataset
metadata.Description: A Japanese-English parallel corpus of travel conversations from the 'Chikyu no Arukikata' travelogue series. It contains approximately 1.1 million sentence pairs from 122 books and includes a document-aligned test set.
Provider: National Institute of Information and Communications Technology
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 12th Language Resources and Evaluation Conference
Affiliations: National Institute of Information and Communications Technology
Nara Institute of Science and Technology
metadata.Abstract: We present the Arukikata Travelogue Dataset, a new, freely available Japanese-English parallel corpus of travel conversations. The corpus was created from a single-author travelogue series, Chikyu no Arukikata (Globe-Trotter Travel Guidebook), which has been published for 40 years. The corpus contains approximately 1.1 million sentence pairs from 122 books. We also provide a document-aligned test set for evaluating document-level machine translation. We conducted a baseline experiment on the corpus and found that it is a useful resource for training and evaluating machine translation systems. The corpus is available at http://www.kecl.ntt.co.jp/icl/lirg/aru.
